intro: Fagara kleinii, commonly known as the Klein's fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Berberidaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Fagara kleinii produces small, round berries that are typically red or orange when mature. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
